My father is diabetic and needs his fridge to keep insulin cold. I was hung up on and disrespected by a so called supervisor. No wonder they are going out of business all over the place. Piss poor customer service. My fathers health is at risk and these people don’t care. I will be filing a complaint with the BBB, FTC and the state AG. They shouldn’t even earn one star.

resp.text: Tommy, we are sorry to hear that you did not have a positive experience with Sears. If you would like us to look into your situation further, please send us a message to  https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/. Please reference this review, thank you.

text: Our service technician came out to repair our dryer. This is the third heating element replaced over a 5 year period. David was our technician, and he was very polite, arrived sooner than the expected arrival time, and he called first thing that morning to let us know where we were on his "list" of service tickets.   He was very friendly even with 2 small yapping dogs. David went to work as soon he stepped into our laundry room and had our dryer taken apart, fixed, and put back together in just over an hour. He showed us the bad element and explained why the element went bad. If I could request a service technician,  I would definitely ask for David, as he knows his stuff and is friendly, polite, and knowledgeable.

name: Hagan Williams
text:
I brought my motorcycle to them for wheel bearings, brake pads and tires... you know, day one techschool stuff. They had my bike for 3 months and neglected to drain the carb or keep it on a battery tender. So now I need to clean the carb and get a new battery. When I got my bike back, the front brakes no longer worked and the front fork seals no longer held air pressure, so now I need new seals and a master cylinder. They put brand new tires on the wheels but left the old valve stems, so the wheels go flat overnight now.

I brought the bike to them with the saddlebags, trunk, crash guards, chrome trim, antennas, lights, trailer hitch and seat already removed so they wouldn't have to deal with any of that. I brought them all the necessary parts except the tires. All they had to get was the tires. They still had my bike for 3 months and tried to charge me over $600 for their half assed bullshittery. They ended up settling for $575 cash.

DO NOT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, BRING A MOTORCYCLE TO THESE IDIOTS

text: This place is a joke and the mechanic is a complete idiot. I brought My 02 bandit in the first time and my  carbs needed needle seats and some other work , that time was ok. Then I took my bike back for a second time and he forgot to put a clamp back on the main fuel line from carbs to tank.when I picked it up they had replaced the brake shoes and when I left it had no rear brake they didn't bleed it. The bike shuts down after forty mins of riding in the middle of traffic.the rear brake caliper broke loose and has bent every thing on the back of the bike so after spending all most 1500 with them I have a bike that doen t run and needs parts that broke because of them. name: Billy Robertson
text: First, my lawnmower only had 26 hours of usage, when the head gasket began to leak. Of course, this was not under warranty and the cost for repair is $284. Labor cost is $102 per hour. I dropped off my lawnmower on a Wednesday.  After calling to check on the status after a week, I was informed a few days later Of the total cost. And then took an additional two weeks for the repairs to be completed. In closing, it took 19 days to do two hours worth of work.  I was never notified nor updated.  When I picked up my lawnmower the only greeting I was met with was your total was $284.80. Terrible customer service, terrible communication and obviously an inferior product.

resp.text: Hi Billy --  we are very sorry you had a negative experience with our Florence dealership. Customer service is very important to us at TriGreen Equipment and we are going to forward these comments to management. We hope you'll consider giving us another try, please contact us directly at 256-233-0339 so we can work to make this right for you.

name: Scott Roysden
text:
Terrible service team !
I have a John Deere skid steer I took in with what seemed to be a hydraulic issue .
I left my machine in what I assumed would be capable hands .
After a few days I was told that it needed a pressure relief valve because the hydraulic pressure was low !!
Remember that statement while I write the rest of this review because it will come back to that !
The part came in and they told me it was ready . I drove an hr to pick up machine got in it and had the same issue as when I dropped it off .
Never got it on the trailer !!!
I left machine with them for yet another wrong diagnosis of bad hydraulic pump !
I got contacted that machine was ready so I picked it up . Still same issues but I needed it to continue with work . They had my machine for almost 2 weeks which is not a problem if I get back a fixed machine.
The repair cost was almost $4000 and machine was still the same as the day I took it .
So after a few weeks of trying the machine it never got better or worse so I knew I still had an issue !
I took it to a repair shop that I was referred to and after 3 hrs I got a call your machine is ready !!!
Exciting news and it was only a issue with computer it was stuck in a precision mode !!
Cost me $164 and the machine works great !!!
I called TRIGREEN and told them and they did absolutely nothing but tell me it needed the parts they installed! Remember the statement I referred to earlier ^ the next section tells you the answer !!

Now here is the kicker precision mode decreases hydraulic flow which was my issue and is exactly what TRIGREEN said but failed to check the obvious because they want to throw parts at your problem and run your bill up ! The parts they replaced was not necessary because it was just stuck in the wrong mode .
I have called corporate and they are sticking with the decision of the Florence store on not making this right .
I’m writing this to warn you off of using this company they are not customer service friendly and incompetent of working on the product they sale .
Hope this helps the next customer with there decision on buying or using this store for anything!!!

resp.text: Hi Scott -- we are certainly very sorry to hear that your experience with TriGreen has left you feeling angry and frustrated. We understand that we are not the intended audience for your review, but we value your feedback, nonetheless. Providing exceptional customer service is very important to us, and when we miss the mark with even one customer, we like to take it as an opportunity to improve. We stand by the work performed by our service departments, but we will communicate your comments to management and work with them to ensure our technicians are being effective and efficient in diagnosing and repairing our customers' equipment. We are very sorry that we seem to have lost your business, but most importantly we are very happy to hear that your skid steer is back in operation. If ever you want to discuss this further, feel free to contact us directly at 256-233-0339.

Then told wasn't sure the cutting deck wasn't level. Then another customer was waited on who came in after me. Sure hope it was worth it Steve, you just lost a local customer.

Every spring I take advantage of Hedden's tune-up special, and get all routine maintenance done. They also do only what is needed, and will ask before any recommended work so there are no "surprised. The mower always comes back clean, sharp, and ready for another flawless season. This is a great place to do business.

name: Zeke H
text: I got a great deal on a Z mower and I love it. Buying at Hedden was easy, fast and simple. The owner of Hedden was a fantastic guide to the mower, and answered or better yet, showed me answers to all my question. Really this is a 5 star company but I deducted one star because the owner did not follow up after the sale. I would have expected this had I purchased the mower at Lowes or Home Depot. Otherwise, I'm happy with Hedden and I will buy my next mower from them. Oh yeah, the guy that delivered my mower was great and very knowledgeable. Remember to buy local and support people in the near community.

name: James Holder
text: Called to price a new part didn’t give me a chance to tell her what all I needed wanted to charge 50 dollars in freight to order a mower deck for a rider.Told her I could order from Gravely direct and didn’t have to pay that amount for shipping needed to order about 300 dollars or so in parts but I will order direct because the young lady I talked to was short spoken and didn’t seem as if she wanted my business. I have purchased here before and had good service but not again.

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience.  We only pass along shipping that is charged to us.  We are sent mower decks by truck line and are charged by size, which is why this amount was higher than a normal freight charge for a parts order.  Again, we are sorry for your experience as we pride ourselves in giving great customer service.

name: Kelly Helser
text: I've taken an older chainsaw and lawn mower to Hedden a couple times over the past few years to keep them running. I've been more than happy with the price and when I pick up my equipment it runs better than new. It's a great feeling to find a shop that you're always confident that they'll do a high quality job and deal fairly with you.

name: John Griffin
text: Great folks to deal with that have an absolutely great attitude of really trying to help their customers. I've done business with them at least 6 times and am very pleased every time. I will continue to do business with them in the future.

name: Todd Edwards
text: will be using hedden again.after the last two trips to a well known huntsville small engine shop that didn't have simple things like blades and a belt.hedden had my off the wall belt 167" in stock and waiting at the parts counter when i got there 10 min later.will be back.

name: Thomas Webber
text: Great people and always willing to share knowledge and help.

name: Reggie Hubbard
text: I just bought my first zero turn mower. I am not a 'for hire' professional, but I've been mowing grass for what seems like my whole life! Mark and crew answered all of my questions, asked me quite a few questions, and then gave me fair comparisons on all the models that were best suited to my needs. If service, honesty, and shopping local mean anything to you, give them a shot at earning your business. You won't be disappointed!

name: Wes Roland
text: I recently purchased a zero turn from Hedden Lawn & Garden and the service was top notch.  I visited several other stores around town before making a decision on my purchase, and the experience at Hedden was far and away the best customer service I encountered.  I went in multiple times before I made up my mind, and every time they were extremely professional, knowledgeable, and remembered who I was.  This is a fantastic business, and all of my servicing and future equipment will be purchased from them.  If you are in the market for any new/used equipment, or if you need any existing equipment serviced, do yourself a favor and check out Hedden.

name: Bruce Rogers
text:
1) Had a problem with my push  lawn mower, would not stay started and Mr. Hedden said give me 5 minutes and just like that it runs like a dream. Not sure what he did but thanks
2) Three weeks later I had work done on my 17 year old LX-277 John Deere and they did a wonderful job on the repairs, runs like new I will definitely come back thanks again
3) After another year I needed some tires and a good once over on my
LX-277 and they got it turned around extremely fast I will continue to rely on Hedden Lawn & Garden !

text: I've used Hedden's a few times. The great customer service they provide, prices and knowledge set them apart. I will be returning and I recommend them highly.

Marks customer service is the best in town IMO and as long as I buy new mowers Hedden Lawn and Garden will be my go to place for all my mowers. I own a Lawncare business and anytime I’ve had a problem which isn’t very often he has always made sure that I haven’t been without a mower. This is another reason why I will always continue to go see Mark. These guys treat you like family. And that’s the kind of place I will continue to keep my business!!!! They have definitely earned a lifetime customer!!!!!

Mark was great to work with and even personally delivered my new mower to my house on the same day  I purchased.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: We are sorry you are having trouble.  We do use impact when putting blades on for safety reasons.  If you want to bring your mower in, we will gladly get your blades off.

name: Veitch Illustrations
text:
Run away!  I left my weedeater there on 4/17/2020 and was told by Carla that she would call me on the following Monday to let me know the cost to fix the pull cord and tune it up.  After two weeks with no call, I called them and of course, Carla was not in and no one else knew anything about it but they promised to have her call me as soon as she got back.  NOTHING.  I called again about a week later.  Carla said the fan was broken and she would find one and let me know the cost because a brand new one would be expensive.  I said that a new one was fine because I wanted my weedeater fixed and back.  I was willing to pay for it.  Another week ... 10 days ... I've lost track of time through all of this.  The bottom line is this ... Carla NEVER calls you, even though she promises she will.  No one else, especially Barry, knows ANYTHING about your item.  You can call all day, but if they don't answer, TOO BAD, because they don't have their voicemail set up.  At one point when I called, Carla offered to sell me a refurbished weedeater since she "couldn't find" a fan, though I doubt she even looked for one.  I said no, I want mine back. I finally just went and picked up my weedeater today (6-4-2020), NOT FIXED and when they brought it out, pieces were missing!  The guy had to go back to the back not once, but TWICE to find them, even after he argued with me about whether or not they existed in the first place.  Then, as I was leaving, he said "Sorry we didn't get it fixed but it just isn't worth it".  Uhhhhmmm, it's worth it to ME and since I would have been the one paying for it, THAT is all that should matter.   I knew better than to take it there because years ago, my mother took one there and they really screwed her over, but that is another story.

DO NOT TAKE YOUR LAWN EQUIPMENT TO THESE PEOPLE.   YOU WON'T SEE IT FOR MONTHS!

name: Jefferey Wills

name: Brittany Hill
text: I work at  a company called Southern Stone Inc. and we rely on our tools everyday. We bought a pressure washer in January of this year and it started smoking while running it so we were not sure what the problem was. We called Ryobi warranty and they had us send the pressure washer to this company. Quality Tool Repair told us to drop it off on that Friday and that they would get someone to look at it and let us know something by Monday. (Our guy that dropped it off said the men he dropped it off with looked high or drunk on something, which is already terrible for business first off) , to make matters worse...No one followed up with us, we even waited until Wenesday to see if someone would contact us. No one did. So we called that Wednesday afternoon and I spoke with Carla. She told us no one had even looked at it still. Even after the fact that we were told She would get someone to look at it and follow up with us on Monday. So then she stated she would get someone to look at it and then call me back. It wasn't even 30 minutes and she called back stating that they had gotten the pressure washer fixed and that they cleaned the air filter and it was no longer smoking. Which was clearly a false statement! We had our guys go pick up the pressure washer and paid a $45.00 service fee for something that was not even touched! (after we were told by Carla that she would refund the fee if it was still not working) We recieved the pressure washer and brought back here to our shop. The guys automatically tested it and it was as if no one had serviced or even touched anything. It was still smoking. We called Ryobi warranty once again and they had us sent to Home Depot to get it serviced and see if they could fix it. So we dropped off the pressure washer for a even smaller service fee of $18.50. Which was way less than the price we paid at Quality Tool Repair. Home Depot even followed back up with us when our pressure washer was fixed. We never had to call and find out was was taking so long. We received it and tested it here at the shop and it was perfect. We had mentioned to Home Depot that we had taken the pressure washer to Qulaity Tools first. He even was in shock when he seen the air filter and everything untouched. Still had gas and oil in it. He said he had heard bad things about the company many times. Home Depot fixed our pressure washer as to where Qulaity Tools did nothing. Not very good for business at all. I even called and spoke with Carla today (5/10/2019) regarding the refund we were told we would get if it still did not work correctly. And she got very angry, talking over me on the phone, I couldn't even get one sentence out barley. I even told her that we took it to Home Depot and they said it had not even been touched. And she said she will not give us a refund and she does not care what happened or what I read on their reviews. Very very rude. She didnt even want to try to help the situatuion and what we had been through. Very unfair to have another company bring you a tool to fix and you end up doing them wrong in the end. We deal with alot of contractors and different workers that rely on their tools everyday and I will be sure to let everyone I know to NEVER visit this company. I will be sure to send them to Home Depot, a real company that has dignity and pride in their customers. Qulaity Tool Repair is quick to fib and very disorganized. You have lost what could have been years to come with tons of business from us. If you a reading this review do not take your tools here. Even if your tool warranty company sends you here like us....REFUSE and go somehwere else. You will be very disappointed in the end if you do deside to take your tools here.

name: Renee Moses
text:
NO STARS!!!!!!!   A piece of the motor of my Ryobi pressure washer broke off...I took it to Quality Tool Repair, where the gentleman that I dropped it off with agreed that it was broken and told me it would be 1-2 weeks.  The second week I contacted them, where the lady told me they were swamped and would give me a call back (never received a call back).  I called again and was told the guy was going to crank it and see if it worked (ummm the motor was broken, which I told her so there woudln't be any point in "trying to crank it").
I called back again the following week and was told the warranty was sent in, then again, was told they were still waiting to hear from Ryobi.   After contacting Ryobi, they hadn't received a warranty for a pressure washer from this place in over a month.  After discussing this with the lady at the repair shop, surprisingly, the next day Ryobi had a warranty but stated they didn't provide enough information.  Ryobi attempted to contact the repair shop numerous times but they never could get in touch with them for additional information.  I then addressed with the lady at the repair shop letting her know Ryobi needed additional information.
This was 3 weeks in and I was supposed to have received a call back from her on Friday 7/6, called and was told she was not in at the time and probably wouldn't be back that day.  Contacted her this morning (after trying for 2 hours) and she was absolutely RUDE and told me the warranty was denied and I tried to explain to her that I mentioned that to her and that Ryobi had been trying to contact them etc. and she went on to say that they were not a non-profit organization and she was not going to pay for my repairs (RUDE!!!!). Then she went onto say, "I'm not trying to be rude, but you probably didn't pay but about $199 for your unit".    WOW...just wow.  I asked her how that was even relevant and she stated that it wasn't and that I could just come get my unit and we'd never have to deal with other again.

name: Matthew McLain
text: I had an older mower that stopped working. I dropped the mower off to them, and told 2 different people that I only wanted to know how much to fix it. I was told they would look at it for around $30, and would not do any work without contacting me. I call back several times with no answer to find out what the issue was. After a week I get a call back saying my bill was $150 for the mower. After much debate, the owner's wife (this is how she identified herself) told me not to worry about it they would just keep the mower and call the cops if I came to collect. We ended up working it out, but these people are a nightmare to work with, and do not honor their word. I hate to leave a negative review, especially for a locally owned shop, but AVOID!!! There are other shops around town in Montevallo and Alabaster...

name: rodneygrill
text:
I wish I could give this place zero stars!  The only reason I went there was because Ryobi lists it as an authorized warranty repair center for my pressure washer.  It failed to start, and I checked the obvious, so I decided to have it repaired under warranty.   I dropped it off and they said they would call me in about a week.  Two weeks later, I had heard nothing so I called.  The phone went to voice mail and said the mailbox was full and hung up on me.  After the call attempts like this, someone did call me back seeing my calls on callerid.

The lady that called back said it was a bad carburetor and that it is not covered under warranty, so it would cost me $55.  I said to fix it and asked when it would be ready.  She said next week and she would call me.  A week went by with no calls.  I called and again got the "mailbox full" message, so I drove to the shop.

When I got there, at first they could not find my paperwork or the pressure washer.  As they were in the back looking for it, I heard them day "bad carb" and then "uh-oh".  The manager came out with my machine and said, "you got a bad carburetor, but you got more problems."  He then demonstrated by trying to pull the starter chord, but the engine was locked-up.  It was not when I dropped it off!

The manager said I had probably run it out of oil.  He cheeked, and it was correctly filed with nice golden oil which I had changed earlier in the year.  I asked how could they know it was a bad carb if they couldn't even start it? The lady at the counter said she'd go ahead and call Ryobi and start the warranty claim.  She said she'd call me next week with status.

A week and a half goes by with no call.  I call them, and this time the number wad out of order.  I drive back to the shop and they tell me the secretary had been out for a week do they had not had time to file a claim.  And the manager again reiterated that it was probably my misuse that caused it to lock up and that Ryobi would likely not warranty it anyhow.  I'm actually a hobbyist mechanic and have rebuilt car and lawn tool engines, so I'm no idiot.

After 5 weeks of no service and deplorable customer service, I took my pressure washer with me and have since dropped it at another service center.

name: David Raphael
text: Everyone from top to bottom at CTE are friendly and professional.  I had a warranty dispute with Briggs and Stratton about a problem with a new engine.  They told me to take it to and authorized B&S svc ctr.  CTE inspected the engine and reported their findings to B&S.  They explained my situation but warranty was denied by B&S.  I persisted for over a month and finally gave up in frustration.  I went to pick up my ruined machine and pay for the labor etc.  There was a little confusion as to how to handle the bill and a gentleman named, Bruce wanted to know what the story was with my mower.  It's a long one but he listened and  agreed that something was wrong.  He said leave it here, send him an email with the whole story and he'd make a few calls.  A week later he called and said B&S had reconsidered and was giving full compensation.  I couldn't believe it, as I am a rare customer.  I brought the mower home yesterday and saw a sign as I was leaving.  Bruce Holder was his name and he was the owner.  Now that is customer service from top to bottom!  I cannot give these folks any possible higher grade or praise.  So I bought them all donuts!  They have a customer for life with me.  I cannot recommend them enough.  Thanks all.

Got it home oil still black and the ridges are worse. I feel.So ripped off. Never again will I buy anymore of their junk. I will be taking pictures and posting on Facebook.

text:
Great experience, great people, great work.  Highly recommend.

The address on Google is incorrect, though.  The correct address is 5421 13th Ave. E., Tuscaloosa, AL 35405-6806.  It's off Jug Factory Road.  Once you have the right address, though, it's easy to find.

name: Claire Slaton
text: I have NOTHING but wonderful things to say about this man!  He immediately started working on our lawn mower when we took it to him.  Was patient and went through the entire repair process explaining things as he went!  He gave me tips along the way to keep my lawn mower healthy and even went back to the drawing board when he realized that it had more than just one thing wrong!  Other people were walking up and he never stopped working, but would ask someone to crank their lawn mower so he could hear what the problem was or would answer a quick question for someone all as he worked diligently on our issue.  He even sharpened my blade!  We were back in the car with a PERFECT lawn mower again in about an hour and he only charged us about $60.  We DEFINITELY have a new "go to" guy for our lawn mower needs!!

name: TJ Case
text: I bent the blade on a push mower. I couldn't remove it to repair it. He removed and straightened it in 5 mins. He even taught me a little bit about my mower. Very reasonably priced.

name: Paul Lane
text: I went to Singley first to get my Toro's self propelled drive fixed... They were very short with me, asked what kind of mower it was and quickly said "we don't work on those." This was the 2nd place on the list, I called and a very nice man told me to bring it on by, didn't matter what it was, he could fix it if it's fixable. He immediately diagnosed the problem and had it running like new the very next morning! The place doesn't look great(old parts piled up everywhere, no office, you can't even really go inside) but none of that is nessassary, if you need anything lawnmower related fixed for a good price by a good, hard working man, this is the place to go. Fixed the motor, new belt and a new blade for $75 in less than a day. Couldn't be happier! THANKS!!

text: This has nothing to do with the repair man. He was polite and very professional. However, I was appalled having to pay $131.50 for a service that did not require a part. Over the years I have spent so much money on appliances with Sears because I believed in Sears. I am giving it up, I will only buy cheap foreign things at least I don't feel taking advantage when the darn thing brakes down. I'll just get another one. This is were you could have increased business by showing you trust your products and if repairs are required after warranty the costs are reasonable. A $131.50 without parts, in my opinion, is unreasonable. Good luck for the future, without me!

name: Hugh B
text:
Horrible!!!  The first technician showed-up to repair my GAS range with no manometer (device to measure gas pressure), then tried to guess at the problem being related to the electronic ignition system.  Then, the second technician shows-up a week later with the manometer but with no adapters to check the gas line or the regulator pressure so just guesses it's probably the regulator.  But, the regulator he orders and delivered to my house is clearly the wrong part so I have to spend hours with their non-native English speaking customer service representatives to cancel the next service call and get a UPS pickup order to return the part.

Now SEARS is fighting my credit card dispute for all the charges including the wrong part that was returned over a week ago.   No wonder the company is having so much financial difficulty.

I WILL NEVER USE SEARS EVER AGAIN!

I knew this was not true because I replaced the blade myself, I was just unable to do it because I had the lawnmower previously serviced and the bolt was tightened we’re I couldn’t remove it. I told him that I was not asking for this to be done for free but he was so nasty and keep saying we don’t do this. I told him that I would take it somewhere else. This is one of the worst places to try to get service on your Husqvarna. Well never ever ever go to this backwoods place again. I’d rather pay to have it done at Lowe’s if it comes down to it. name: Billy Maxwell
text:
,        BUYER BEWARE!!!!!

Last May I purchased a commercial zero turn, commercial chain saw as well as the commercial hedge trimmer. I told the owner I wanted a suspension seat and he told me if I would buy, he would throw the seat in but he had to make sure he had the seat ..i was then told he had it. I purchased the items and was told to let him know when I could bring it back to have the seat put on. He told me he would need a week to get it mounted. i was helping a friend in the area and carried it by early Monday morning and that's when this guys true colors started showing. I passed by there about three or four times (didn't stop) between Monday and Thurs just to see if it was being worked on but it NEVER MOVED!!! I called on Fri morning and told them I needed to come get my mower (meaning I needed to cut my 3 + acres of grass and bring it back on Monday but I did not say that) and the lady I spoke with said she would let him know. I get a call back in about 10 mins and the same lady informs me that he (the owner) said that if I came and got MY mower he would never put that seat on for me. Well after going around and around with husqvarna Corp. They got me set up with a real dealer that knows how to treat people ..i have to drive farther but I don't have to put up with this clown. To tell you what kind of character you will be dealing with, when I started dealing with the other company, they inform me there isn't a suspension seat for my Z554 in the entire husqvarna corporation because it is a brand new model. I wonder how this guy had one? It's a MIRACLE!!!! Also, on Friday when I picked my mower up the fuel gauge on the left hand tank was showing empty, tank was full but not showing it. I saw several very negative reviews on this place before I bought but like an idiot I bought from this....GUY anyway.
BIG MISTAKE!!!!! SAVE YOURSELF A LOT OF HEADACHES AND NEVER BUY ANYTHING FROM THIS GUY!!!!! HE ALSO OWNS THE STORE IN PELHAM!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!!!

BUYER BEWARE!!!!!

The whole buying experience was pleasant, and there is no doubt in my mind that if this unit ever requires any maintenance, that L and S Small Engine will take care of both my mower and of me. Can not express how much of a positive experience this was.

Rude, arrogant, and verbally abusive toward his female co-worker, whom I suspect was his wife. He embarrassed  her in front of another customer and me for several minutes. Then, he was rude to me. He has no concern for customers and he falsely advertises that he does small engine repair. Wrong. He sells Husqvarna equipment. If I wanted any I'd fly to Alaska to buy it before I'd drive the short distance to Montevallo, AL. The Better Business Bureau will be hearing from me about this jerk next. If I could give him zero stars I would.

I don't know what the big stink is with the owner. He's really a knowledgeable individual. Walked in for a part on my mower that was broken. Brought the part with me, he matched it perfectly! Went home and installed everything back to OEM standards and viola!

I will be going back to L&S for my mowers!

P.S. to those who don't like the labor hours, maybe you should learn a little about your mower and fix it yourself. With this method you can skip out on labor charges. 😎

So now I will have to sand and paint all the rust as long as I own it. It just sucks having to do that when you pay $1300 for a 12 foot trailer and get this result.

resp.text: Mr. Coley, Muddy Waters is a dealer of Native Trailers LLC, we have sent your info over to the manufacture they are the ones that would supply the warranty on the trailer. We are sorry for the inconvenience . If you do not hear from them please give us a call.

name: Kristin Watson
text: My husband and I bought not just one but two little four wheelers for our kids,   I had been shopping g around d we got a fair price for them.  The reason for my one star, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  My kids wore down the brakes, I don't think they were hard on them, or our brake light is working.  We called while they were under warranty.  It took two weeks to get back about parts.  At that point the parts were out of warranty.  So we paid for them and shipping.  We got the wrong parts.  I even took picture the second time.  We got parts that look similar but size was wrong, would not work.  So Mailed them back along w one of the brake pads off the 4 wheeler and tracked them..  I found out that the package was delivered Thursday 4/28 .  I called and was told spouse was sick bit she sent picture to manufacture.  No call that we got them, they are working on it,, nothing.  This has been the way we have been treated.  You have to chase them down to get answers.  I asked to be called by the end of the week, with answers and a solution!  I haven't been able to ride our 4 wheelers since early March!  It's May 2nd!  It's not like we got these for free and didn't pay for replacement parts or shipping!

name: Daniel Callins
text: I am so happy I found this place. I purchased a Hammerhead 250ss go cart second hand and when I purchased it, it would turn over but not start. The owner said the he let the go cart sit up for a year, but it did run but was pretty sure the carburetor needed cleaning. I took it to Basch Brothers in Cullman, because this is where the cart was originally purchased. I told them that I wanted to get the carburetor cleaned  and to look over the go cart for anything else it needed. They called me the next day and said it had no compression. I told them that's odd because when I purchased the cart, I checked the compression and it was at 90lbs. They said I don't know what to tell you but we are only get 60lbs. AT this point I understood they didn't want to work on it and I picked it up and took it to Dr. Joe's in Ensley. They found the carburetor was gumed up and the vacuum line. They return the go cart to me  the next day completely fixed. The fee was only $115 and the work was completed quicker than I expected.

text:
I have been going to Walt's Small Engines for close to twenty years now and have always had first class service. They do not have the flash of the big shops, but they are honest and are not out to make a huge profit for repairs like some of their competitors I have used in the past. They do the work that is required and nothing else.
They have never tried to up sell me on anything! They will pick up and drop off which is great as I don’t have the capacity to haul all of my equipment to them, and they charge less for this service than any other shop I have dealt with in the past.
They are a small shop and that is what I like about them. It is a family owned business and they conduct day to day activities as if they were getting their own lawn equipment worked on!
I highly recommend this lawn equipment repair and parts shop.

name: James Gatlin
text:
I brought in two motorcycles, one had a good motor and the other a blowed motor. I asked that he put the good motor on the good bike. We had a gentleman's agreement that I would pay more than a thousand dollars, and that would include two new tires. After looking closer at the tires I had I found that I had two good tires between the two bikes. I tried calling to check on the progress on my bike, but wasn't able to speak with anyone. Phill, the owner tells me, when I went in to check on my bike, that they got trash in my carbs. He had the carbs off my bike and was supposedly cleaning them. When he called me and told me my bike was ready I picked it up and only two cylinders was firing, the clutch was slipping, and the carbs were pouring gas. I took it back  the same day under the 30 day warranty to have it properly fixed. When he called me that my bike was ready and I went to pick it up he tries to charge me another $350.00. I called the police out to try and get my bike, but they said they couldn't get invovled and I would have to pay the money or get an attorney. I didn't trust him to leave my bike any longer, so paid the money to get my bike. My bike is sitting in my yard with the carbs still flooding out. After more than $1,400 dollars spent and I still can't drive my bike. If you value your property, do not take it to Prattville power sports. I'm getting an attorney and going to court.

Today June 4, 2019, I had the pleasure of meeting the new owners of Prattville power sports. I had bought a new battery from phill when he done the work on my bike. Today I found out that the battery he put in my bike wasn't the same battery he said he put in. That it was a cheaper version, but he charges me for the more expensive battery. The new owner pulled out the old bills and showed me the difference and then gave me the battery that I was suppose to have from the beginning. I now believe and tmhave complete trust in the new owners and plan to do my business with them now that I know phill is gone. Thank you Prattville power sports.

name: G M
text:
Horrible Service Department!
After numerous attempts to get the service department on the phone, I finally got through and unfortunately decided to drop off my mower for repair.  A week and a couple follow-up calls later, they still don't know what is wrong with my mower.  A couple days later, I'm told it's the auto choke in the carb although there is a choke on the handle.  A few days later, they are still waiting on the Honda parts rep to call them back.  Next day, I'm promised an estimate; I hear nothing.  I call the next business day (Monday) when I'm told i will have an estimate by the end of the day, but I told them if I didn't hear back that afternoon (2+ weeks later), I was picking my mower and not paying the diagnostic fee.  Do you think I got a call?  Nope.  At least they're consistent. I picked up the broken mower the next day without paying.  I would avoid this place, for service, like the plague.

Also of note, they do not use computers to document your equipment's problem, part number, or your contact info; they use a small notebook.  While I'll appreciate simplicity, I expect a business to be organized--not this service department!

If I could give zero stars or even negative, since my mower carburetor gasket was ripped during diagnostics, I would.

name: adam weber
text:
So on 11 Aug 18 I bought a JD riding mower (E100) from Lowes. Prior to this I physically visited SunSouth to purchase a mower but was told that I would need to go to a place like Lowes or Home Depot. I used my mower 3 times and noticed that the engine was leaking oil. On 29 Sep (when I noticed the leak), I called Lowes since I also purchased an extended warranty. They said that they would have someone come out to pick it up and that they would call the day before they were supposed to pick it up (scheduled for today 4 Oct) and give me a time. They were also supposed to call the day of pick up to let me know they were on the way.

Still haven't received a phone call and it it currently 4:21 pm. They close at 5 pm. My wife called Lowes back today at about 3:40 pm and they said they would contact them again and if we didn't hear from them that Lowes would call someone else.

Needless to say, I am NOT happy at all. I don't know about all of the other experiences, but so far mine is terrible. I will update if I get a call. Hopefully they can redeem themselves and get more than one star. I would give 0 stars if that were an option right now.
